page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW OF BEAFORD
page.content: Beaford is a small village situated on the B3220 road 5 miles from Great Torrington and 7 miles from Winkleigh. The electoral roll for the parish contained 283 names. The area is undulating countryside, mainly pasture-land for dairying, beef and sheep. Some arable land is used for crops of roots and corns, used chiefly for winter feed of stock. The village is situated on higher land above the River Torridge, at about 350 feet above sea level. Valleys are quite steep, and a feature of the area is its hills and valleys, with copses of deciduous trees and fir plantations interspersed amongst the farm lands. Plant growth is generally lush and rich, the area averaging some 40 inches of rain per year. Most roads beyond the main road are very narrow, often only single track.
